intro: Acourtia wislizeni, commonly known as the desert lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a purple or red tinge. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a tall flowering stalk that can reach up to 3 feet in height. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Acourtia wislizeni is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
